title.value: IG-RL: Inductive Graph Reinforcement Learning for Massive-Scale Traffic Signal Control
title.justification: The title is clearly stated at the beginning of the document along with the authors' names and the abstract.
title.quote: IG-RL: Inductive Graph Reinforcement Learning for Massive-Scale Traffic Signal Control

extractions.description: The paper introduces Inductive Graph Reinforcement Learning (IG-RL), a method based on graph-convolutional networks for scalable traffic signal control. The method can generalize to new road networks and traffic distributions without additional training, making it a scalable solution compared to previous methods. The approach is decentralized and compared to several baselines, showing superior performance in managing traffic signals in large networks, such as Manhattan with 3,971 traffic signals.

type.justification: The paper tests the proposed method on both synthetic and real-world traffic networks, comparing the performance of the IG-RL model with other approaches.
type.quote: The proposed method is tested on both road networks and traffic settings never experienced during training. We compare IG-RL to multi-agent reinforcement learning and domain-specific baselines.

name.justification: The focus of the paper is on scaling adaptive traffic signal control using reinforcement learning techniques.
name.quote: We introduce Inductive Graph Reinforcement Learning (IG-RL) based on graph-convolutional networks which adapts to the structure of any road network, to learn detailed representations of traffic signal controllers and their surroundings.

name.justification: The method proposed, IG-RL, heavily utilizes graph-convolutional networks.
name.quote: We introduce inductive graph reinforcement learning (IG-RL), which combines the inductive capabilities of graph-convolutional networks (GCNs) [16] with a new decentralized RL (DEC-RL) framework.

name.justification: The paper introduces and focuses extensively on the Inductive Graph Reinforcement Learning model.
name.quote: We introduce Inductive Graph Reinforcement Learning (IG-RL) based on graph-convolutional networks.

is_contributed.justification: The paper presents IG-RL as its main contribution.
is_contributed.quote: We introduce Inductive Graph Reinforcement Learning (IG-RL) based on graph-convolutional networks.

is_executed.justification: The paper discusses the implementation and testing of IG-RL on large-scale traffic signal networks.
is_executed.quote: The proposed method is tested on both road networks and traffic settings never experienced during training.

is_compared.justification: IG-RL is compared against several baselines and other multi-agent reinforcement learning models in experiments.
is_compared.quote: We compare IG-RL to multi-agent reinforcement learning and domain-specific baselines.

referenced_paper_title.justification: There is no specific reference paper for IG-RL as it is an original contribution of this paper.
